full_summary:
====================================

### Automated Coverslipping System

**Notice Title**: Automated Coverslipping System

**Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

**Solicitation Number**: WS3707820538

**Publication Date**: November 2, 2022

**Tender Closing Date** (amended): November 22, 2022, 2:00 p.m. EST

The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) is seeking an automated coverslipping system to increase process automation and efficiency for diagnostic services in support of CFIA’s National Animal Health Programs. The successful bidder will provide a system that meets all specifications as detailed in this tender.

### Tender Requirement

The tender requires the supply and installation of an automated coverslipping system that will increase process automation and efficiency for diagnostic services in support of CFIA’s National Animal Health Programs. The system must meet all the specifications as detailed here.

### Evaluation Criteria

* Lowest Price

This tender is competitive and will be awarded based on the lowest price.

### Contact Information

Questions or requests for bid documents shall be directed to Stephen Van Den Hanenberg at stephen.vandenhanenberg@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca.

### Attachment

There are no attachments to this notice.

### Notice Link

To access this notice, please visit the Ariba Discovery website: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14527631?extsite=MTQ1Mjc2MzFfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Expiration

This tender has expired.

### Finance Trade Agreements

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

This tender is open to all contractors who are eligible under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement. The contract will be awarded based on the lowest price. The end user entity is the Canadian Food Inspection Agency. The acquisition region is the National Capital Region, Quebec. The expected start date of the contract is on December 2, 2022, and the expected end date is on December 30, 2023.  Labor and scientific equipment are required. References to any government contract shall be made to “Minister des Travaux publics et des Services gouvernementaux (SPAC)” or “Minister of Public Works and Government Services”. References to any government supplies shall be made to the “Canwinner- Acquisition.Trade contracts required”, in compliance with Contract Procedure Regulations, Preferential procurement).
